settings.quote_content:
In a world of “advance” this is a nice tiny step back.

I got through the first 22 levels and do noticed that there is definitely an increase in difficulty. I think that so many of us spend so much time on our phones and looking at social media as well as television that we lose a little bit of simplicity and games like this. No this will not track of your movements or keep track of how many wins you have in how many moves but it is extremely fun to play and a nice break from the other ‘screens’ we tend to look at all day.

My kids LOVE it

On the surface, when my kids (actually, young adults, 18 and 20) play with this game, it looks for all the world like they're on their cellphones. However, they're actually doing something much more beneficial: solving puzzles, which is highly stimulating to the brain. This game is genius. It appeals to cellphone addicts who are used to holding and looking at something in their hands, only instead of just texting or passively looking at content, they're being mentally and visually challenged. It also appears to fidgety folks who need some kind of gadget to play with to reduce anxiety

Not Cheap, but in the end, worth the money

I went on a Survivor binge and became obsessed with finding a slide puzzle to play. I used to love those thin, cheap slide puzzles with pictures on them as a child. As soon as the thought “Slide Puzzle” left my mind, my phone magically intercepted the thought and within hours I saw someone reference this one on tik tok. It has been well received! Up to four people use it at any given time and it is sturdy. The pieces are slightly magnetized it seems, and it is easy to set up the next puzzle. The puzzle begin easy and progress at a slow to moderate pace. We love it

settings.heading: Bring your child to rest away from electronic screens

settings.text:
GiiKER (derived from “Geeker”) is a technology company with a dedication to the development of smart and connected edutainment products. Alongside with the connected products, GiiKER also develops mobile apps with playful contents to bring a whole new level of user experience.

In 2018, we launched the world’s first smart connected cube - SUPERCUBE®. Awarded by Forbes as one of the best tech toys of the year and endorsed by MoMa as the next generation of cube, Supercube has been sold in more than 100 countries and regions with cumulative apps downloads of more than 15 million by end of 2020.
